newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Peugeot's Brazil unit changes chief.
newsitem.headline: Peugeot's Brazil unit changes chief.

text.p: Peugeot SA's Brazilian unit has named Cees Hermanns as its superintendent replacing Thierry Peugeot, who is returning to France, the company said in a statement.
Hermanns, who will take office on April 1, is a former superintendent of Peugeot's unit in the Netherlands.
In 1997, the company expects to increase sales by 44 percent to 12,000 cars from 8,300 cars last year, Hermanns said.
He said the company plans to increase annual sales in Brazil to 40,000 cars in the next four to five years.
Peugeot has been conducting market studies to build a car plant in Brazil, which would cost around 3 billion French francs.
Hermanns would not say when the company expected to announce its decision.
